result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Dismiss ordering count 2 of the action dismissed without prejudice because the defendant successfully completed the Deferred Judgment Agreement.
Motion hearing on February 9, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Enter Judgment of Conviction.

ADDRESS INFO for David J. ROEHRIG
Current: 1122 Hawthorne Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2016)
Prior: 1346 N. 8th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

ADDRESS INFO for David J. ROEHRIG
Current: 1346 N. 8th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2016)
Prior: 2318 Herman Rd., Manitowoc, WI 54220

The State moves to delete the enhancer in count 2.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended count 2, disorderly conduct.  
The Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty but withholds entry of judgment of conviction pursuant to a Deferred Judgment Agreement.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, endanger safety by use of dangerous weapon.  Motion granted.
The Court approves the Deferred Judgment Agreement for twelve (12) months.
Review date:  01-20-2017
The Court modifies bail to $500.00 recognizance bond while the Deferred Judgment Agreement is pending.  $500.00 cash bail transferred to case no. 15TR3258 and applied to forf & costs.
Recognizance bond executed.
Minutes.

Notice of Motion; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection; Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant.
Cover letter.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 11-25-15 at 10:00 a.m.  Plea date is set for 12-03-15 at 1:30 p.m.

Letter indicating Attorney Joseph Pozorski, Jr has been retained.

Initial appearance is set for 10-19-15 at 1:30 p.m.
